titleStmt.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton, January 29, 1890

bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, January 29th, 1890.

Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith,
To the Department of State

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, January 29th, 1890.

Honorable William F. Wharton,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.

I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith the returns and reports of the Consular Agent of the United States, at Elmina, for the quarter ended December 31st, 1889, as follows: Arrivals and departures of American vessels; Summary of business; Digest of Invoice-book; Return of trade with the United States; Detailed report of official services to American vessels.

I am,
sir,
your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith.
U.S. Consul General.

Enclosures, five: - Arrivals and departures of American vessels; Summary of business; Digest of invoice book; Return of trade with the United States, Detailed report of official services to American vessels.
